GPtrArray* luau_db_getAllDBKeys (  const char *  category,
const char *  subcategory
) 
 

Get an array of all keys in the database.

Get all the keys in the specified database using libdb's 'cursor' interface. Returns NULL on error.

  • category is the main category where the key is stored (actually the database filename)
  • subcategory is the sub category where the key is stored (actually the database name)
    Returns:
    a GPtrArray of all the keys in specified database (must be free'd), or NULL on failure.

gboolean luau_db_keyExists (  const char *  category,
const char *  subcategory,
const char *  key
) 
 

Check for key existence.

Find if a key exists in the specified database. Note that this will also return FALSE if the database doesn't exist, or there is an error in opening it.

  • category is the main category where the key is stored (actually the database filename)
  • subcategory is the sub category where the key is stored (actually the database name)
  • key is the name of the key we want to see exists
    Returns:
    TRUE if the key exists, FALSE otherwise

Definition at line 107 of file database.c.

References luau_db_queryDatabase().

void* luau_db_queryDatabase (  const char *  category,
const char *  subcategory,
const char *  key
) 
 

Database query.

Query for the value associated with the given key. Returns NULL if the query failed, or if there's no such key in the database.

  • category is the main category where the key is stored (actually the database filename)
  • subcategory is the sub category where the key is stored (actually the database name)
  • key is the name of the key we want to find the data for (we only support strings as keys)
    Returns:
    the associated data (must be free'd), or NULL otherwise

Definition at line 65 of file database.c.

References ERROR, getDatabaseP(), and keepOpen.

Referenced by isHidden(), luau_db_keyExists(), and luau_getProgInfo().

gboolean luau_db_setValue (  const char *  category,
const char *  subcategory,
const char *  key,
const void *  value,
size_t  size
) 
 

Set a key/value pair in the database.

Set the value of key to value in the category.subcategory database. Overwrites previous value if one exists, or creates a new pair otherwise. size must contain the size (in bytes) of value.

  • category is the main category where the key is stored (actually the database filename)
  • subcategory is the sub category where the key is stored (actually the database name)
  • key is the name of the key we want to set/change
  • value is the new value
  • size is the size of the new value (in bytes)
See also:
luau_db_setValueString

luau_db_setValueInt

gboolean luau_db_setValueInt (  const char *  category,
const char *  subcategory,
const char *  key,
int  value
) 
 

Set a key/value pair where the value is an integer.

Front-end to luau_db_setValue for setting string values in the database. Otherwise works the same as luau_db_setValue.

  • category is the main category where the key is stored (actually the database filename)
  • subcategory is the sub category where the key is stored (actually the database name)
  • key is the name of the key we want to set/change
  • value is the new value
See also:
luau_db_setValue

gboolean luau_db_setValueString (  const char *  category,
const char *  subcategory,
const char *  key,
const char *  string
) 
 

Set a key/value pair where the value is a string.

Front-end to luau_db_setValue for setting string values in the database. Otherwise works the same as luau_db_setValue.

  • category is the main category where the key is stored (actually the database filename)
  • subcategory is the sub category where the key is stored (actually the database name)
  • key is the name of the key we want to set/change
  • value is the new value
See also:
luau_db_setValue

DB * openDatabase (  const char *  category,
const char *  subcategory,
gboolean  needWrite
)  [static]
 

Open a database.

Open and return a DB pointer for the given database. Returns NULL on error. *

  • category is the main category where the key is stored (actually the database filename)
  • subcategory is the sub category where the key is stored (actually the database name)
  • needWrite specifies whether we need write permissions
    Returns:
    a DB pointer for the database (must be closed when finished), or NULL if operation fails
